heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There is a storm around.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (212°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.5°C) and outside temperature (down 2.7°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (up 8 mbar) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.3 mm) and cloud levels (up 748 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 228.7m higher than yesterday, 647.1m lower than the past week, 747.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 568m minimum and 931m maximum, with an average of 958.2m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1605.3m and 1705.9m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and calm and still conditions are expected. A few light raindrops may fall, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (87%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
